title: HMD Global reveals three new budget Nokia phones with Android 11 Go
content:
HMD Global has been selling Nokia-branded Android phones for years at this point, though in recent history, it has started to slip behind with software support. That isn’t stopping the company from making even more phones, and now there are three more budget devices on the way: the Nokia C21 Plus, Nokia C21, and Nokia

The post HMD Global reveals three new budget Nokia phones with Android 11 Go appeared first on xda-developers.
description: HMD has three new budget phones aimed at international markets, with bottom-of-the-barrel hardware and Android 11.
